biog.entry.name: DANBY, the Hon. Michael David
biog.entry.description: Biography for DANBY, the Hon. Michael David
biog.entry.electorate.name: Member for Melbourne Ports (Vic)
biog.entry.title: Biography for DANBY, the Hon. Michael David
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Melbourne Ports (Vic)
biog.entry.party.name: Australian Labor Party

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Melbourne Ports, Victoria, 1998, 2001, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

ministerial.appointments.title: Ministerial Appointments
ministerial.appointments.para: Parliamentary Secretary for the Arts from 25.3.13 to 18.9.13.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Privileges from 8.12.98 to 8.10.01; Selection from 18.2.02 to 17.10.07; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Affairs from 20.3.02 to 20.3.03; Procedure from 4.12.13.
Joint Statutory: Intelligence and Security from 18.11.10 to 17.6.13.

Joint Standing: Electoral Matters from 8.12.98 to 4.12.00 and from 26.6.01 (Deputy Chair) to 19.7.10; Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade from 2.12.04 to 14.5.13 and from 4.12.13; Migration from 18.2.08 to 19.7.10; Parliamentary Library from 2.12.13.
Joint Select: Republic Referendum from 9.6.99 to 9.8.99; Cyber-Safety from 18.3.10 to 19.7.10 and from 12.10.11 to 14.5.13.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Shadow Parliamentary Secretary to the Leader of the Opposition and Shadow Parliamentary Secretary for the Arts from 18.10.13.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: Member, ALP Caucus Social Policy Committee.
Secretary, ALP Caucus National Security and Trade Committee.

other.positions.title: Other Positions
other.positions.para: Deputy Chair, Australia/US Parliamentary Friendship Committee.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Assistant Private Secretary to the Hon. B Cohen, MP 1983-84.
Senior Vice-President, International Youth Conference, Kingston, Jamaica 1985.
Adviser to the Minister for Tourism, the Hon. AG Griffiths, MP 1993-94.
Industrial Officer, Shop, Distributive and Allied Employees' Association 1994-96.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: inner Melbourne; it includes the suburbs of Albert Park, Balaclava, Caulfield, Caulfield East, Elwood, Middle Park, Port Melbourne, Ripponlea, St Kilda, St Kilda East, St Kilda West, Southbank and South Melbourne, and parts of Docklands, Elsternwick and South Yarra.
Industries: car assembly plants, aircraft parts production, stevedoring and various manufacturing, commercial and retail industries.
State electorates: Melbourne Ports includes the Victorian Legislative Assembly electorate of Albert Park, and parts of Brighton, Caulfield and Prahran.
